name: Nokia
goal:
Nokia creates the technology to connect the world.
Powered by the research and innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we serve communications service providers, governments, large enterprises and consumers, with the industry's most complete, end-to-end portfolio of products, services and licensing.
From the enabling infrastructure for 5G and the Internet of Things, to emerging applications in virtual reality and digital health, we are shaping the future of technology to transform the human experience.
Nokia consists of the business groups Applications & analytics (A&A), Fixed networks (FN), Global services (GS), IP/optical networks (ION), Mobile networks (MN), and Nokia Technologies (Innovation and patent/technology licensing).
Altogether, Nokia has approximately 100,000 employees, with major sites in Finland, France, Germany, Poland, Hungary, Portugal, Belgium, India, China, the US, Russia, Brazil and Indonesia. Net sales of Nokia, in 2017 were around €23 billion. R&D investments were around €4.9bn in 2017.
interests: Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Transport
